conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval from 0 to \( t_2 \), we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph for object B.
The graph for object B is the curve labeled 'B' in the image.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
On a v-t graph, the slope of the tangent to the curve at any point represents the acceleration at that instant.
At \( t = 0 \), the slope of the curve for object B is positive, indicating that the object is accelerating.
As time progresses from 0 to \( t_1 \), the slope of the curve decreases, meaning the acceleration is decreasing.
At \( t = t_1 \), the slope of the curve is zero, indicating that the acceleration is zero at this point.
From \( t_1 \) to \( t_2 \), the slope of the curve becomes negative, indicating that the object is decelerating (negative acceleration).
From 0 to \( t_1 \), the acceleration decreases from a positive value to zero.
From \( t_1 \) to \( t_2 \), the acceleration becomes negative and increases in magnitude (becomes more negative).
The acceleration of object B decreases from a positive value to zero and then becomes more negative as time progresses from 0 to \( t_2 \).
